item.title: Great Indian Republic Day Sale 2025: Top smartphone deals on Amazon - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Great Indian Republic Day Sale 2025: Top smartphone deals on Amazon

Published: 13 January 2025 | Source: Deccan Herald

Amazon has kicked off its annual Great Indian Republic Day sale, offering attractive discounts on various smartphones. Here are some of the best deals available during the sale.

  • Apple iPhone 15 series: iPhone 15 priced at Rs 56,999 with an exchange offer up to Rs 45,000 off. iPhone 15 Plus at Rs 69,900 with up to Rs 48,000 off.
  • Vivo X200 5G: Available for Rs 65,900 with a discount and exchange offer of up to Rs 51,600.
  • Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra: Priced at Rs 71,990 after applying a discount coupon of Rs 2,000.
  • OnePlus 13R: Discounted to Rs 42,998 with an additional exchange offer.
  • Samsung Galaxy A35 5G: Now offered at Rs 22,999 with an exchange offer up to Rs 21,800.
  • Honor 200 5G: Priced at Rs 21,998 with a notable exchange discount.
  • Nothing Phone (2a): Available for Rs 21,270 with an exchange offer.
  • Oppo A74 5G: Discounted to Rs 15,489 with an up to Rs 14,700 exchange offer.
  • iQOO Z9s 5G: Priced at Rs 19,498 with exchange options available.
  • Redmi 13 5G: Available for Rs 12,280 with significant exchange savings.

Check out these deals quickly as they are limited-time offers during the sale.

item.title: 'PM Modi’s decisive 3rd term victory': Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw fact checks Mark Zuckerberg on 202 - The Times of India
item.description:
PM Modi’s decisive 3rd term victory: Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw fact checks Mark Zuckerberg on 2024 Lok Sabha elections

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has refuted comments made by Mark Zuckerberg regarding the upcoming 2024 Lok Sabha elections, emphasizing the strong position of PM Modi's government and its anticipated decisive victory.

  • Vaishnaw highlights the achievements of Modi’s government in key sectors.
  • He counters Zuckerberg's assertions, underpinning the electoral readiness of the ruling party.
  • The minister emphasizes public confidence ahead of the impending elections.
"The people of India are well aware of the facts and will make the right choice in the upcoming elections," stated Vaishnaw.

This rebuttal signifies the confidence of the ruling party as it prepares for the electoral battle ahead, framing Modi's administration as one focused on progress and development.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025 live: Holy dip performed by 1.6 crore people till 4 pm on first day - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025 live: Holy dip performed by 1.6 crore people till 4 pm on first day

Publication Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The 45-day Mahakumbh Mela has commenced, projected to witness over 40 crore attendees, with around 1.6 crore devotees performing a holy dip by 4 pm on the first day.

  • Over 1.6 crore devotees participated by 4 PM on the first day.
  • Sangam has seen almost 60 lakh devotees by 9:30 AM on day one.
  • Significant bathing rituals planned on January 14 (Makar Sankranti) and other dates.
  • Safety measures are in place with extensive security arrangements, including over 40,000 personnel deployed.
  • CM Yogi Adityanath emphasizes the event's significance for cultural heritage.
“A symbol of India's spiritual, cultural heritage,” said UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

The event highlights the merging of spirituality with safety measures, claiming to offer a profound experience for attendees across the globe.

item.title: 92 HMPV test kits arrive in Jamshedpur, testing to begin today - Avenue Mail
item.description:
Jamshedpur Receives 92 HMPV Test Kits to Begin Testing

Publication Date: Today, Source: The Avenue Mail

In light of the increasing cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) across the country, Jamshedpur is preparing to confront the potential health threat as 92 test kits arrive for testing.

The testing will start on Monday, with the focus on early detection to prevent the virus's spread.

  • 92 test kits have been supplied to the Virus Research and Diagnostic Laboratory (VRDL).
  • Testing for HMPV will start on Monday.
  • Five suspected patients will be tested weekly as per ICMR guidelines.
  • No confirmed cases in Jamshedpur yet, but readiness is key.
  • The district is ramping up surveillance efforts to monitor potential cases.
“Updated information about the HMPV virus is continuously coming in. We are preparing accordingly.” - Dr. Diwakar Hansda

The authorities are closely monitoring the situation, with further guidelines expected as new cases are identified.

item.title: Indian fighting for Russia killed in Ukraine war, deceased hailed from Kerala: Report - Firstpost
item.description:
Indian from Kerala Dies Fighting for Russia in Ukraine War

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

A man from Kerala named Binil TB has died while fighting for the Russian military in Ukraine. This report highlights the recruitment of Indian nationals to the ongoing conflict, often through fraudulent means.

  • Binil TB was 32 years old and hailed from Thrissur, Kerala.
  • His relative, Jain TK, was injured in the same incident.
  • Officials from the Indian embassy in Moscow verbally confirmed his death.
  • Binil's family reported that he died in a drone attack.
  • Indians recruited for military roles often find themselves on the frontlines despite being promised non-combatant jobs.
  • Ajith Kolassery from NORKA ROOTS mentioned there is a lack of formal information on the incident from the Ministry of External Affairs.
“Mentally and physically, we are exhausted. We have been pleading with local commanders for our release.” - Binil TB

This incident raises concerns over the plight of foreign fighters in Ukraine and the deceptive recruitment practices used by the Russian military.

item.title: Apple's Next Watch SE Model to Arrive Later This Year With New Look: Mark Gurman - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Apple Watch SE 3 Could Arrive With a Redesigned Look

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets 360

Apple's affordable Watch SE has not seen a yearly upgrade since its inception in 2020. A third-generation model is expected to be launched with a redesigned look.

  • The new Apple Watch SE is reported to have a design makeover, possibly swapping out the aluminum shell for plastic.
  • Expected launch alongside the iPhone 17 series in September.
  • Apple Watch Series 11 and Watch Ultra 3 models will likely be introduced, retaining a similar design to their predecessors.
  • New features for Apple Watch Ultra may include satellite connectivity and 5G RedCap network access.
  • A revamped health app and AI coaching service are also in development.
“A fresh version of the lower-end SE model will sport a new look,” said Mark Gurman.

The introduction of the Apple Watch SE 3 seems to mark a significant update to the series, aligning with advancements and expectations set by its predecessors.

item.title: iPhone 16 gets a flat Rs 10,000 discount on Flipkart - The Indian Express
item.description:
iPhone 16 gets a flat Rs 10,000 discount on Flipkart

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The four-month-old iPhone 16 has received its first significant discount and can now be bought for Rs 69,999 on Flipkart. With bank discounts and exchange offers, prices may drop to Rs 63,999.

  • iPhone 16's current retail price is Rs 69,999 with discounts available.
  • HDFC card users can avail a flat Rs 2,000 discount.
  • Users can get an additional Rs 4,000 discount for exchanging select smartphones.
  • The iPhone 16 features a 48 MP main camera and can shoot 4K Dolby Vision videos.
  • It is compact with a 6.1-inch screen and offers water and dust resistance with an IP68 rating.
“For anyone considering a new iPhone, the iPhone 16 is an excellent choice, especially for those who want to experience the latest innovations from Apple.”

Overall, the discount on the iPhone 16 makes it a compelling offer for consumers looking for a premium smartphone experience.

item.title: Risks of taking vitamin D in the wrong way and how to take it safely - The Times of India
item.description:
Risks of Taking Vitamin D in the Wrong Way and How to Take It Safely

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Vitamin D is essential for bone health, immune function, and calcium regulation. However, improper intake can lead to serious health risks, making it crucial to understand how to take it safely.

  • Vitamin D toxicity can occur from excessive intake, leading to serious health issues.
  • Improper vitamin D intake can cause calcium imbalances, kidney stones, and cardiovascular problems.
  • Gastrointestinal issues may arise from taking vitamins improperly.
  • Vitamin D can interact with several medications, necessitating a discussion with healthcare providers.
  • Testing blood levels prior to supplementation is crucial for safety.
“Do not take high doses of vitamin D without medical supervision.”

Taking vitamin D safely involves understanding its proper use, monitoring levels, and avoiding self-diagnosis.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025 live: Holy dip performed by nearly 1 crore people on first day - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025 Live: Nearly 1 Crore Perform Holy Dip on Day 1

Date & Source: January 13, 2025 - Hindustan Times

The Mahakumbh 2025 Mela has commenced in Prayagraj, attracting millions of devotees for a sacred bathing ritual, including nearly 1 crore people participating on the first day. The massive event, lasting 45 days, is expected to see over 40 crore attendees.

  • Nearly 60 lakh devotees took a holy dip by 9:30 AM on day 1.
  • Shahi Snan scheduled for January 14, marking Makar Sankranti.
  • Safety measures in place, including drone surveillance and extensive security arrangements.
  • Over 50,000 QR codes installed for location identification and complaints.
  • Three hospitals established on highways for attending to devotees' health needs.
“Holy dip performed by nearly 1 crore people on the first day.” - UP Police chief Prashant Kumar

The event commenced with an emphasis on safety and cultural significance, with statements from political leaders highlighting its importance to Indian heritage.

item.title: 'Hoist with his own petard': Congress mocks PM Modi as rupee hits all-time low - The Times of India
item.description:
Congress Mocks PM Modi as Rupee Hits All-Time Low

Date: [Publication Date] | Source: [Source]

The Indian rupee has reached an all-time low, prompting significant mockery from Congress towards Prime Minister Modi. The political rivalry has intensified with this economic development.

  • The rupee's value fell sharply against the dollar.
  • Congress utilized this opportunity to criticize PM Modi's economic policies.
  • Statements and social media posts from Congress leaders amplified the mockery.
  • This economic event sparks discussions about the government's handling of currency values.
“Hoist with his own petard,” was a notable remark from a Congress leader, emphasizing their criticism.

This incident underscores the volatile situation in India’s economy and the political ramifications of currency fluctuations.

item.title: PM Modi, accompanied by Nitin Gadkari, Omar Abdullah, and others, inaugurates Z-Morh tunnel in J&K’s Sonamarg - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Inaugurates Z-Morh Tunnel in J&K’s Sonamarg

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the strategic Z-Morh tunnel in Ganderbal’s Sonamarg area, which is expected to enhance connectivity and boost tourism in the region.

  • The 6.5-kilometer tunnel was built at a cost of ₹2,700 crore.
  • PM Modi highlighted the tunnel's importance in reducing the distance between J&K and Delhi.
  • The project aims to support local economies and improve access during harsh weather conditions.
  • PM Modi did not provide a timeline for the restoration of Statehood to J&K during the inauguration.
  • Notable projects mentioned include the upcoming Zojila tunnel and other major connectivity projects in J&K costing ₹42,000 crore.
“I salute the dedication of workers who braved harsh weather conditions... No worker returned home.” - PM Narendra Modi

The inauguration marks a significant milestone for J&K as it moves forward to enhance its infrastructure and tourism potential, aiming for a more connected and progressive region.

item.title: Budget 2025: Revised Income Tax Slabs, Higher Standard Deduction, Section 80C Limit Increase – Know Key Exp - News18
item.description:
Budget 2025: Revised Income Tax Slabs, Higher Standard Deduction, Section 80C Limit Increase – Know Key Expectations

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: News18

As Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepares for the upcoming Budget 2025 announcements, several key income tax reforms are anticipated. Here are five significant changes expected:

  • Increased Standard Deduction: A proposal to raise the standard deduction for salaried individuals from ₹50,000 to possibly ₹1 lakh.
  • Revised Income Tax Slabs: Adjustments to the 30% tax rate threshold, expected to apply for income exceeding ₹20 lakh.
  • Senior Citizens’ Tax Reforms: Potential benefits such as increased exemption limits or reduced tax rates for senior citizens.
  • Greater Section 80C Deduction Limit: Recommendations to raise the Section 80C limit from ₹1.5 lakh to ₹3.5 lakh.
  • Possible Import Duty Hike on Gold: An increase in the import tax on gold to address trade deficit concerns.
“Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget 2025-26 on February 1.”

These proposed changes reflect the government's intention to alleviate the tax burden on individuals, particularly in light of inflation and rising living costs.

item.title: These four Apple devices may get upgraded in 2025 - The Times of India
item.description:
Apple Set to Upgrade Four Devices in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Apple is planning significant upgrades for four of its product lines that have not seen any major updates in years. These include the iPhone SE, HomePod mini, Apple TV, and Mac Pro.

  • The iPhone SE will receive a major redesign, adopting Face ID and a modern aesthetic.
  • The HomePod mini is expected to get a full refresh, moving beyond color updates.
  • The Apple TV will be redesigned, marking its first update since 2022.
  • The Mac Pro will feature a new high-end chip, expected to launch before updated MacBook Pro models.
“The budget-friendly phone will also support Apple's new AI features, though its price may increase from the current $429.”

In conclusion, these upcoming updates signify Apple's commitment to refreshing its product lineup and enhancing its integration with new technologies.

item.title: 10 Animals That Have Been To Space - News18
item.description:
10 Animals That Have Been To Space

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: News 18

The article discusses various animals that have ventured into space, highlighting significant missions and their contributions to scientific understanding.

  • The first animals in space were fruit flies, sent on February 20, 1947.
  • Albert II, a rhesus monkey, was the first monkey in space on June 14, 1949.
  • The first mouse went to space in 1950, reaching an altitude of 137 km.
  • Laika, the dog, became the first animal to orbit Earth in 1957.
  • Tortoises were part of the Zond 5 mission in 1968.
  • NASA launched frogs in 1970 on the Orbiting Frog Olotith mission.
  • In 1973, spiders were studied for their web-spinning ability in microgravity.
  • Fish, specifically the mummichog, were sent into space in 1973.
  • Tardigrades were the first known animals to survive the vacuum of outer space in 2007.
  • Nematodes survived the disintegration of the Columbia shuttle in 2003.
“The first ‘aquanauts’ to reach space were a type of minnow found in salt marshes.”

This article illustrates the intriguing history of animals in space exploration and their roles in scientific research.

item.title: Retail inflation eases to four-month low of 5.22% in December - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Retail Inflation Eases to Four-Month Low of 5.22% in December

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

India’s retail inflation reduced to 5.22 percent in December, marking the first drop below 9 percent in food inflation over the past four months. This change is significant amid ongoing concerns from the Reserve Bank of India regarding high inflation rates.

  • Retail inflation fell from 5.48% in November to 5.22% in December.
  • This represents the fourth consecutive month of inflation above 5%.
  • Food prices contributed to the easing of inflation, dropping below 9% for the first time in four months.
“High inflation has been one of the reasons that the Reserve Bank of India has refused to budge on policy change.”

This retreat in inflation offers a potential respite for consumers and signals a possible shift in monetary policy considerations from the Reserve Bank of India.

item.title: ‘When will you add Delhi’s Jats to Centre’s OBC list?': Arvind Kejriwal asks PM Modi, Amit Shah - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Demands Inclusion of Delhi's Jats in OBC List

Date: Jan 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent press conference, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) convenor Arvind Kejriwal reiterated his call for the inclusion of the Jat community from Delhi in the Centre's Other Backward Classes (OBC) list, emphasizing that they are currently excluded from central government job reservations.

  • Kejriwal wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the inclusion of Delhi's Jats in the OBC list.
  • The Jat community in Delhi feels betrayed by the BJP regarding reservation promises made by Modi and Amit Shah.
  • BJP dismissed Kejriwal’s demands as an “election gimmick” and cited the Delhi government’s lack of action on the matter.
  • Kejriwal stated that Jats from Rajasthan receive benefits that Delhi Jats do not, demonstrating inequality.
“When will they include Delhi's Jats in the Centre's OBC list?” - Arvind Kejriwal

The ongoing request from Kejriwal highlights the political tension and the struggles within community support and representation ahead of upcoming elections.

item.title: Shreyas Iyer makes history after being named Punjab Kings captain - The Times of India
item.description:
Shreyas Iyer Makes History as Punjab Kings Captain

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Shreyas Iyer has made history by being named the new captain of Punjab Kings (PBKS) for IPL 2025, becoming the first Indian player to lead three different IPL teams.

  • Iyer previously captained Kolkata Knight Riders to an IPL title victory in 2024.
  • He was signed by PBKS for a record-breaking Rs 26.75 crore during the auction.
  • Under his leadership, Delhi Capitals reached the final in 2020.
  • Iyer is the only captain in IPL history to reach the final with two different teams.
  • Before Iyer, only two players had led three different franchises: Mahela Jayawardene and Steve Smith.
“I am honoured that the team has reposed its faith in me. I am looking forward to working again with coach Ponting.” - Shreyas Iyer

The 2024 season was a remarkable one for Iyer as he not only won the IPL but also led Mumbai to victory in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, alongside winning the Ranji Trophy and the Irani Trophy.

item.title: Watch: BLACKPINK’s Jisoo Announces Solo Comeback Date With Mysterious New Teaser - soompi
item.description:
Watch: BLACKPINK’s Jisoo Announces Solo Comeback Date With Mysterious New Teaser

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Soompi

Jisoo from BLACKPINK is making her much-anticipated solo comeback with a new teaser that reveals a release date of February 14, 2025.

  • Jisoo's return will be marked with a new teaser released on January 13 at 6 p.m. KST.
  • The solo comeback follows nearly two years since her debut album “ME”.
  • The teaser has fans eagerly guessing what to expect.
“Are you ready for Jisoo’s comeback? Stay tuned for more updates!”

This comeback is expected to generate significant excitement among fans of BLACKPINK.

item.title: Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling? - News18
item.description:
Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling?

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: News18

Indian blue-chip indices, Sensex and Nifty, saw significant declines on Monday. The BSE Sensex dropped over 1,100 points, while the Nifty50 lost 350 points, responding to a stronger-than-expected US jobs report.

  • US jobs report suggests delay in Federal Reserve rate cuts.
  • BSE Sensex fell to a low of 76,250; Nifty50 slid to 23,047.
  • Market capitalization of BSE-listed companies fell by Rs 14.54 lakh crore.
  • Foreign portfolio investors continued aggressive selling of Indian stocks.
  • Weakening rupee hit an all-time low of Rs 86.27 against the US dollar.
“Markets are under pressure due to multiple headwinds. The strong US jobs data has reduced expectations of rate cuts by the Fed in 2025.” - VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

The decline in Indian markets reflects a combination of domestic pressures and global economic conditions, presenting a challenging environment for investors.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18: From Shilpa Shirodkar’s fight with sister Namrata to Karan Veer Mehra opening up about his alcoholism; Top revelations from the show - The Times of India
item.description:
Bigg Boss 18: From Shilpa Shirodkar’s fight with sister Namrata to Karan Veer Mehra opening up about his alcoholism; Top revelations from the show

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a recent episode of Bigg Boss 18, Shilpa Shirodkar shared an emotional moment regarding a dispute with her sister Namrata Shirodkar, reflecting on their estrangement prior to entering the show.

  • Shilpa opened up about a disagreement with her sister that lasted for two weeks.
  • The discussion occurred during a special guest appearance by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap.
  • Shilpa expressed her feelings of missing her sister and hoped for reconciliation.
“I really, really miss her a lot. I hope she comes.” - Shilpa Shirodkar

This segment highlighted Shilpa's personal struggles and the emotional toll of being away from her family while on the show.

item.title: India's Champions Trophy Squad: Big Surprises As Sunil Gavaskar, Irfan Pathan Announce Their Team - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India's Champions Trophy Squad: Big Surprises As Sunil Gavaskar, Irfan Pathan Announce Their Team

Publication Date: June 30, 2024

Source: NDTV

As Indian cricket fans await the big ICC Champions Trophy announcement from the BCCI, former cricketers like Irfan Pathan and Sunil Gavaskar have shared their preferences, highlighting key players they believe should be included in the squad.

  • Gavaskar emphasizes the importance of including KL Rahul, Shreyas Iyer, and Rishabh Pant in the middle order.
  • Gavaskar suggests that Sanju Samson's recent performances necessitate his inclusion in the squad.
  • Irfan Pathan advocates for a spin-bowling duo of Ravindra Jadeja and Kuldeep Yadav.
  • Pathan also mentions the importance of Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami as key pace bowlers.
  • Both Gavaskar and Pathan omit notable players like Suryakumar Yadav and Axar Patel from their selections.
“If I am sitting there I will say who has done really well in the recent past. KL Rahul had a fantastic 50-over World Cup.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The selections made by Gavaskar and Pathan are generating discussions among fans as the official squad announcement approaches.
